skill.name: senior-qa
skill.description: Comprehensive QA and testing skill for quality assurance, test automation, and testing strategies for ReactJS, NextJS, NodeJS applications. Includes test suite generation, coverage analysis, E2E testing setup, and quality metrics. Use when designing test strategies, writing test cases, implementing test automation, performing manual testing, or analyzing test coverage.
skill.summary: Comprehensive QA and testing skill for quality assurance, test automation, and testing strategies fo...
skill.author: alirezarezvani

security_audit.summary: All 58 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The analyzer incorrectly flagged TypeScript template literals as shell backticks, argparse help text as weak crypto, and standard file writing as dangerous. This is legitimate QA documentation and testing scripts.

content.user_title: Generate test suites and analyze coverage
content.value_statement: Quality assurance teams struggle with inconsistent testing practices and low test coverage. This skill provides automated test suite generation, coverage analysis, and E2E testing setup for React, Next.js, and Node.js applications.
actual_capabilities: Generate comprehensive test suites for React, Next.js, and Node.js applications
Analyze code coverage and identify gaps in testing
Set up end-to-end testing frameworks with best practices
Provide QA best practices and testing strategy documentation
limitations: Does not execute tests or interact with external testing services
Does not modify production code or deploy to live environments
Generated tests require manual review and customization for production use

use_cases.title: Automate Test Suite Creation
use_cases.description: Generate comprehensive test suites for new features and refactored code with one command

use_cases.title: Coverage Gap Analysis
use_cases.description: Identify untested code paths and improve test coverage metrics across the codebase

use_cases.title: E2E Testing Setup
use_cases.description: Establish standardized end-to-end testing patterns across multiple projects and teams

prompt_templates.title: Generate Unit Tests
prompt_templates.scenario: Create tests for a new component
prompt_templates.prompt: Generate unit tests for my React component at src/components/UserProfile.tsx. Include tests for all props, states, and error handling scenarios.

prompt_templates.title: Analyze Coverage
prompt_templates.prompt: Run coverage analysis on my Next.js project at ./src and identify the files with lowest test coverage. List specific functions and components that need tests.

prompt_templates.title: Setup E2E Tests
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up E2E testing framework for my Node.js API. Include tests for authentication, CRUD operations, and error responses.

prompt_templates.title: QA Best Practices Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my current testing approach and recommend improvements based on best practices. Consider unit, integration, and E2E test balance.

output_examples.input: Generate tests for my login form component
output: Generated 12 unit tests covering email validation, password requirements, error messages, and success states
Created test utilities for mocking authentication API calls
Added snapshot tests for rendering variations

output_examples.input: Analyze test coverage in my backend API
output: Coverage at 67%: 5 files below 50% coverage identified
Missing tests for: user deletion endpoint, rate limiting logic, error handling middleware
Recommended: Add integration tests for user routes

output_examples.input: Set up E2E testing for my e-commerce checkout
output: Configured Playwright with custom fixtures for cart and checkout flows
Created 8 E2E scenarios: product search, cart management, payment processing, order confirmation
Added visual regression testing for checkout pages

best_practices: Run test generation before committing new features to ensure baseline coverage
Combine coverage analysis with code review to catch untested edge cases
Customize generated tests to match your team's naming conventions and assertions
anti_patterns: Using generated tests without review - always validate test logic matches expected behavior
Aiming for 100% coverage - focus on meaningful tests over coverage metrics
Ignoring E2E tests - they catch integration issues unit tests miss

faq.question: What testing frameworks does this skill support?
faq.answer: The skill generates tests compatible with Jest, Mocha, Pytest, and similar xUnit frameworks. E2E tests work with Playwright and Cypress.

faq.question: Does the skill execute tests?
faq.answer: No, this skill generates test files and analyzes coverage. You run tests using your project's test runner.

faq.question: Can I customize the generated test templates?
faq.answer: Yes, you can modify the generated tests after creation. The skill provides a starting point that you tailor to your needs.

faq.question: What code coverage metrics does it analyze?
faq.answer: The analyzer identifies statement, branch, and function coverage. It highlights specific untested code paths and provides recommendations.

faq.question: Is this skill suitable for legacy codebases?
faq.answer: Yes, you can run coverage analysis on any codebase. Test generation works best with well-structured code but can still provide useful templates.

faq.question: Does this skill work with monorepos?
faq.answer: Yes, point the scripts to specific package directories within your monorepo to generate and analyze tests for individual projects.
